channel.title: Dainton Copse Forest School CIC
channel.description: Recent content on Dainton Copse Forest School CIC

item.title: About
item.description: About us Using a Forest School approach, Dainton Copse Forest School CIC runs nature-based activities for children and their families in our beautiful woodland environment. Originating from Scandinavia, forest school uses the woodland setting as both a classroom and a playground. The child-led philosophy encourages children to be resilient, independent and confident learners. Research has shown that spending time outdoors has a positive effect on children’s mental health, too: children tend to have better focus and are less anxious if they spend more time in nature.

item.title: Sessions
item.description: Sessions Little Chestnuts £9 per session 6 week program Birthday Parties Birthday parties in the woodland are great fun and we love helping you to celebrate! Plenty of fresh air, space to roam and - best of all - no birthday cake trodden into your carpet or crisps to sweep up when everyone has gone home!

item.title: Team
item.description: Our Team Sara Sara is a teacher, forest school leader, tutor, mum and the founder of Dainton Copse Forest School. She was lucky to have an ‘outdoorsy’ childhood and loves to share her passion for the outdoors with the visitors that come to the woodland. Knowing that our children are the future caretakers of our planet motivates her to support young people in fostering positive relationships with our wonderful natural world.
